00001 #ifndef _sock
00002 #define _sock
00003 
00004 #define NUM_SOCKS           100   // The maximum number of sockets we support.
00005                                   // Notes:
00006                                   //   1) No allowance is made for reusing sock
00007                                   //      numbers on different addresses; this
00008                                   //      is an absolute limit.
00009                                   //   2) Usable socks are numbered from 
00010                                   //      1..(NUM_SOCKS - 1).  0 is a special 
00011                                   //      value (as indicated below) which 
00012                                   //      indicates that the socket is
00013                                   //      unspecified.
00014 #define NUM_PORTS           65536 // The number of ports on each IP address.
00015                                   //   As above, 0 is a special case that 
00016                                   //   indicates that the port is unassigned.
00017 #define NUM_IP_INTERFACES   10    // The number of distinct IP addresses we can
00018                                   //   support (limitation is imposed to 
00019                                   //   constrain the size of the port array).
00020 #define BIN_SIZE            65536 // The size of the input buffer.
00021 #define BOUT_SIZE           65536 // The size of the output buffer/
00022 
00023 #define UNSPECIFIED_SOCK    0
00024 
00025 #endif
